intro: Phyteuma orbiculare f. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy roundleaf phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its specific epithet "pubescens." It typically grows in meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding ornamental value to gardens.
